message: I have the opportunity to print my designs on a bunch of different tees models
I could also offer a whole bunch of merch, that are not even tees...
but my feeling is that I should be targetted on one single apparel...
Still, I also feel that the client can choose by himself the weight/quality of the shirt he wants to buy...
so what do you think? give more choice to the end user about price/quality, or choose one apparel/price/quality and offer only this one?
You can buy lots of things everywhere, I'd go for the niche and try to bag some loyal customers, then expand to other apparel and merchandise.
@Lloyd I agree: if I want en masse stuff cafepress is what I think of. I'd do something like threadless.com and offer my own designs plus publish other good designers as well.

After a couple of days, and wearing / washing / wearing / washing cycles, I decided to keep only the American Apparel quality t-shirt. It just felt wrong to sell tee's I would not enjoy to wear myself, even for a better price...  Thanks a lot for your comments :)
